content: If it's possible to start over, - be sure thunderbird is NOT running on either PC - copy the c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder to external media - on new PC, copy the thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming - that will overlay the existing thunderbird folder - start thunderbird on new pc and everything should be there - now, you mention an IMAP account showing as POP. That does not work and may be the source of your problems. if you changed accounts, I recommend removing the bigpond account and creating the telstra account new. You may need to share more information here to resolve this.
creator: davidsk

creator: sfhowes

content:
I concur with sfhowes. We regularly post the transfer information and it has been a rock solid transfer process.

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

And a search on this forum for 'transfer' would have brought up repeated posts on these steps. Your intent on being constructive reflects a lack of research on the information available here.

creator: rod.willmott

content:
Thanks for describing your folder pane.

I need a little more information.

First, let's find out where deleted messages are set to go now.

  1. Right-click on the name of the account above the local folders.
  2. Click on "Settings ..." in the drop-down menu.
  3. In the tab that appears next, click on "Server Settings" under the name of the account that is missing its "Deleted" folder.
  4. Find the option "When I delete a message:". Is "Move it to this folder:" selected? Which folder is selected? Is it the folder where you want deleted messages to go?

Would you please click on the "View" menu, then on "Folders", and tell me which items have check marks?

You seem to have an account above the local folders and an account (Home Account) below the local folders. Are they the same account or different accounts? What is the name of the account above your local folders?

I am guessing that they are different accounts. So try this:

  1. Right-click on the name of the account above the local folders.
  2. Click on "Subscribe ..." in the drop-down menu.
  3. In the window that appears next, click on the "Refresh" button and wait a few seconds for the list of folders to be refreshed.
  4. Do you see a folder named "Trash" or "Deleted" or "Deleted Items" in the list? If you do, check the box next to it and click on the "OK" button. There should now be a "Deleted" folder where you expect it to be.

If the accounts above and below the local folders are the same accounts, then we will do something else.

Please report on your progress and results.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Well, at least you know where your deleted messages are going: back to your in-box. When you accidentally delete a message, you can look for them there. You just won't be able really to delete them until we solve this problem.

I would still like to know your folder settings. Would you please click on the "View" menu, then on "Folders", and tell me which items have check marks?

And I would still like to know your accounts. You have "Local Folders" and "Home Account", but apparently something else too. What is it?

Is there really no account name above the local folders? Above the inbox, sent, and saved folders in your "regular e-mail section"? Is there some bold text that says "Favorite folders" or "All Folders" or similar?

If you feel ambitious, you might try these instructions for taking a screenshot of your folder pane: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-to-make-screenshots

A screenshot of your accounts in account settings would be helpful too. Right-click on an account name. Take a screenshot of the left pane in the window that appears.

Or I will wait for your son and try to help later.

content: The solution is to copy the messages to Local Folders to keep, so that you can then delete the old account. Here is a simple way: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder - exit thunderbird - you are now in profile - assuming a POP account, click Mail folder, and then click the account folder - select the inbox file (NOT the msf file) and copy to the Mail\Local Folders folder - repeat for each file to save - restart thunderbird and the message folders should appear in Local folders - after confirming that all is well, you can now delete the old account
